meanings.definition: A group of chemical compounds found in plants that have antioxidant properties.
meanings.sent1: Many fruits and vegetables contain phenolics that help protect our cells from damage.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying the benefits of phenolics in preventing diseases like cancer.
meanings.sent3: The phenolics in the spinach were like tiny superheroes fighting off the harmful molecules.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge about phenolics was a shining light in the dark world of antioxidants.
meanings.sent5: The colorful berries were bursting with phenolics, like a natural shield against harm.

meanings.definition: Any compound containing a phenol group.
meanings.sent1: The scientist identified the phenolics in the lab by their distinct chemical structure.
meanings.sent2: Phenolics are commonly used in the production of plastics and pharmaceuticals.
meanings.sent3: The phenolics in the beaker seemed to be having a party, bonding with other molecules.
meanings.sent4: The phenolics in the solution acted like a glue, holding the mixture together.
meanings.sent5: The strong smell in the room was due to the phenolics reacting with the air.
